title: Coco Huang
author: Coco Huang
content: Liquid immersion cooling systemsCan miners work well and overclock?

comments.author: NotFuzzyWarm
comments.body: Ya know, there are MANY topics about this in not only in this section but the Hardware area as well. The Forum does not need yet another thread about it.Perhaps if you spend a little effort reading those threads you will find your answers - and more...

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: I'll give you some of them if you are lazy searching for themHere check these threads- https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5375377.0- https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5333022.0And this youtube video https://youtu.be/aRw4YFYu8ooAnd actually, there are many guides and reviews on Youtube mostly they worked and can be overclocked if you flash them with modded firmware(Braiins OS/ASIC.to). Also, you can try to ask this user JustaVirus he recently bought s19pro and setup immersion cooling for this unit.

comments.author: 2PIC_CT
comments.body: Hello everyone,In my recent exploration of cooling solutions for crypto mining, I stumbled upon The CoolTank Project. They're developing immersion cooling solutions, like the CoolTank 75KW and an upcoming 10KW model, aiming to boost mining profitability and efficiency by allowing a 40% overclock.They're currently working on their first samples, which could bring some exciting developments to the crypto mining industry.You can learn more about their project here: https://www.thecooltank.com/crowdfundingI thought this might spark some interesting discussions in our community.

comments.author: Z390
comments.body: Hope you are ready for this, I see you are newbie but know that it's very costly to have an immersion cooling system installed, I prefer the natural air from mother nature, all you have to do is find the perfect spot in your home, or garage, I believe garage are better with well-opened ventilation, you will save more money using well-ventilated location.

They're developing immersion cooling solutions, like the CoolTank 75KW and an upcoming 10KW model, aiming to boost mining profitability and efficiency by allowing a 40% overclock.They're currently working on their first samples, which could bring some exciting developments to the crypto mining industry.You can learn more about their project here: https://www.thecooltank.com/crowdfundingI thought this might spark some interesting discussions in our community.Where is the video of CoolTank 75KW and CoolTank 10KW?It's more rewardinghttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OKgpPsjDP5ghttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VxPAVpkTZFMSuch cooling systems are best used when you have the opportunity to use the heat from the liquid to heat your home or garden. And for a solution with noise, the noise box will be cheaper.

comments.author: NotFuzzyWarm
comments.body: Quoteaiming to boost mining profitability and efficiency by allowing a 40% overclock. Over clocking does NOT increase efficiency! Running miners faster actually decreases the THs/J figure. The only way to improve THs/J is to decrease speed and lower the Vcore applied to the chips. That is just the nature of these beasts. That said, the vastly improved cooling certainly does allow for running them faster but at the cost of efficiency.

comments.author: 2PIC_CT
comments.body: Quote from: NotFuzzyWarm on July 03, 2023, 05:17:05 PMQuoteaiming to boost mining profitability and efficiency by allowing a 40% overclock. Over clocking does NOT increase efficiency! Running miners faster actually decreases the THs/J figure. The only way to improve THs/J is to decrease speed and lower the Vcore applied to the chips. That is just the nature of these beasts. That said, the vastly improved cooling certainly does allow for running them faster but at the cost of efficiency.Thank you for your input, NotFuzzyWarm. You're absolutely right that overclocking doesn't increase the THs/J efficiency. However, in the rapidly evolving world of cryptocurrency mining, the lifespan of a miner is typically 2-3 years before newer, more efficient models hit the market.In this context, the goal of many miners isn't necessarily to maximize THs/J efficiency, but rather to maximize the total output (THs) of their miners within their effective lifespan. This is where our CoolTank technology comes into play. By allowing a 40% overclock, we enable miners to significantly boost their total output, thereby increasing their mining profitability before their miners become outdated.Of course, this approach may not be suitable for everyone, and it's always important for each miner to consider their own specific circumstances and objectives. But for those looking to maximize their short-term returns, our CoolTank technology offers a compelling solution.

comments.author: 2PIC_CT
comments.body: Quote from: Z390 on July 01, 2023, 03:39:20 PMHope you are ready for this, I see you are newbie but know that it's very costly to have an immersion cooling system installed, I prefer the natural air from mother nature, all you have to do is find the perfect spot in your home, or garage, I believe garage are better with well-opened ventilation, you will save more money using well-ventilated location. Quote from: Z390 on July 01, 2023, 03:39:20 PMHope you are ready for this, I see you are newbie but know that it's very costly to have an immersion cooling system installed, I prefer the natural air from mother nature, all you have to do is find the perfect spot in your home, or garage, I believe garage are better with well-opened ventilation, you will save more money using well-ventilated location. Thank you for your insights. Natural air cooling and well-ventilated locations can indeed be cost-effective solutions for small-scale or home-based mining operations. However, when it comes to larger-scale operations, especially in hot climates, air cooling can become less efficient and more challenging.I have extensive experience running a mining farm in Dubai, where temperatures can reach up to 50 degrees Celsius in the summer. In such conditions, air cooling is not sufficient to prevent overheating, and the cost of air conditioning can be prohibitively high.That's why I developed the CoolTank, a 2-phase immersion cooling system specifically designed for these challenging environments. It allows for a 40% overclock, significantly boosting mining profitability, and it's adaptable to a wide range of environments.While the initial setup cost for an immersion cooling system can be higher than for an air-cooled system, the increased mining output and the savings on cooling costs can make it a worthwhile investment in the long run.You can learn more about my journey and the development of the CoolTank on our website: [CoolTank About Us](https://www.thecooltank.com/about).

Unfortunately I can't add pictures to u message here. I created a blog post on my website to answer your message. https://www.thecooltank.com/post/ntroducing-advanced-cooling-technologies-for-cryptocurrency-mining-in-the-uaeThe main idea is immersion cooling is for long term mining. You'll squeeze maximum from every new model of miner and be ahead of competitors. Economy of scale is also is very useful. I am working on small CoolTank for home use.
